segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 4. devatāvagga
segments.en: 4. Deities

segments.pli: 34. Mahāmoggallānasutta
segments.en: 34. With Mahāmoggallāna

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
segments.en: Then as Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,

segments.pli: “katamesānaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti:
segments.en: “Which gods know that they are

segments.pli: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti?
segments.en: stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening?”

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tisso nāma bhikkhu adhunākālaṅkato aññataraṃ brahmalokaṃ upapanno hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time a monk called Tissa had recently passed away and been reborn in a Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Tatrapi naṃ evaṃ jānanti:
segments.en: There they knew that

segments.pli: “tisso brahmā mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo”ti.
segments.en: Tissa the Brahmā was very mighty and powerful.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evamevaṃ—jetavane antarahito tasmiṃ brahmaloke pāturahosi.
segments.en: And then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Addasā kho tisso brahmā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
segments.en: Tissa saw Moggallāna coming off in the distance,

segments.pli: Disvāna āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: and said to him,

segments.pli: “ehi kho, mārisa moggallāna; svāgataṃ, mārisa moggallāna;
segments.en: “Come, my good Moggallāna! Welcome, my good Moggallāna!

segments.pli: cirassaṃ kho, mārisa moggallāna; imaṃ pariyāyamakāsi, yadidaṃ idhāgamanāya.
segments.en: It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.

segments.pli: Nisīda, mārisa moggallāna, idamāsanaṃ paññattan”ti.
segments.en: Sit, my good Moggallāna, this seat is for you.”

segments.pli: Nisīdi kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno paññatte āsane.
segments.en: Moggallāna sat down on the seat spread out.

segments.pli: Tissopi kho brahmā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
segments.en: Then Tissa bowed to Moggallāna and sat to one side.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho tissaṃ brahmānaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno etadavoca:
segments.en: Moggallāna said to him,

segments.pli: “Katamesānaṃ kho, tissa, devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti?
segments.en: “Tissa, which gods know that they are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening?”

segments.pli: “Cātumahārājikānaṃ kho, mārisa moggallāna, devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti.
segments.en: “The gods of the Four Great Kings know this.”

segments.pli: “Sabbesaññeva nu kho, tissa, cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti?
segments.en: “But do all of them know this?”

segments.pli: “Na kho, mārisa moggallāna, sabbesaṃ cātumahārājikānaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti.
segments.en: “No, my good Moggallāna, not all of them.

segments.pli: Ye kho te, mārisa moggallāna, cātumahārājikā devā buddhe aveccappasādena asamannāgatā dhamme aveccappasādena asamannāgatā saṅghe aveccappasādena asamannāgatā ariyakantehi sīlehi asamannāgatā na tesaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti.
segments.en: Those who lack experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and lack the ethics loved by the noble ones, do not know that they are stream-enterers.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho te, mārisa moggallāna, cātumahārājikā devā buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatā, dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgatā, saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgatā ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgatā, tesaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti.
segments.en: But those who have experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and have the ethics loved by the noble ones, do know that they are stream-enterers.”

segments.pli: “Cātumahārājikānaññeva nu kho, tissa, devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti udāhu tāvatiṃsānampi devānaṃ … pe …
segments.en: “But Tissa, is it only the gods of the Four Great Kings who know that they are stream-enterers, or do the gods of the Thirty Three …

segments.pli: yāmānampi devānaṃ …
segments.en: the Gods of Yama …

segments.pli: tusitānampi devānaṃ …
segments.en: the Joyful Gods …

segments.pli: nimmānaratīnampi devānaṃ …
segments.en: the Gods Who Love to Create …

segments.pli: paranimmitavasavattīnampi devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti?
segments.en: and the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others know that they are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening?”

segments.pli: “Paranimmitavasavattīnampi kho, mārisa moggallāna, devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti.
segments.en: “The gods of these various classes know this.”

segments.pli: “Sabbesaññeva nu kho, tissa, paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti?
segments.en: “But do all of them know this?”

segments.pli: “Na kho, mārisa moggallāna, sabbesaṃ paranimmitavasavattīnaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti.
segments.en: “No, my good Moggallāna, not all of them.

segments.pli: Ye kho te, mārisa moggallāna, paranimmitavasavattī devā buddhe aveccappasādena asamannāgatā, dhamme aveccappasādena asamannāgatā, saṅghe aveccappasādena asamannāgatā, ariyakantehi sīlehi asamannāgatā, na tesaṃ devānaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti.
segments.en: Those who lack experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and lack the ethics loved by the noble ones, do not know that they are stream-enterers.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho te, mārisa moggallāna, paranimmitavasavattī devā buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgatā, dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgatā, saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgatā, ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgatā tesaṃ evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti: ‘sotāpannā nāma avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’”ti.
segments.en: But those who have experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and have the ethics loved by the noble ones, do know that they are stream-enterers.”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno tissassa brahmuno bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā: “seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya, pasāritaṃ vā bāhaṃ samiñjeyya; evamevaṃ: ‘brahmaloke antarahito jetavane pāturahosī’”ti.
segments.en: Moggallāna approved and agreed with what Tissa the Brahmā said. Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from that Brahmā realm and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: Mahāmoggallāna is visited by a Brahmā god who had formerly been a mendicant, and they discuss which of the gods are stream-enterers.
